articles.headline: Cyprus Sets Up Tight Controls as Banks Prepare to Reopen
articles.snippet: Cyprus announced severe restrictions on access to bank accounts Wednesday, hoping to curb what is likely to be a rush to withdraw money.
articles.abstract: Cyprus announced severe restrictions on access to bank accounts Wednesday, hoping to curb what is likely to be a rush to withdraw money.
articles.lead_paragraph: NICOSIA, Cyprus — The Cypriot government on Wednesday announced severe restrictions on access to funds held in the country’s banks, hoping to control a rush to withdraw money when the banks open Thursday for the first time in nearly two weeks.

articles.headline: Fleeting Thoughts, Captured by Pixels
articles.snippet: Introducing the note pad Google Keep, a combination Web site and app for Android phones. Wait, that sounds like Evernote.
articles.abstract: Introducing the note pad Google Keep, a combination Web site and app for Android phones. Wait, that sounds like Evernote.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the early days of personal computers, people talked about how great they’d be for managing recipes. Remember?

articles.headline: Elite in China Face Austerity Under Xi’s Rule
articles.snippet: President Xi Jinping has imposed a form of austerity on China’s free-spending elite officials, warning that graft and gluttony threaten to bring down the Communist Party.
articles.abstract: President Xi Jinping has imposed a form of austerity on China’s free-spending elite officials, warning that graft and gluttony threaten to bring down the Communist Party.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — Life for the almighty Chinese government official has come to this: car pools, domestically made wristwatches and self-serve lunch buffets.

articles.headline: Hedge Fund Titan Buys Hamptons Property for $60 Million
articles.snippet: Steven A. Cohen is known for his rapid-fire trading style, moving in and out of stocks with dizzying speed at his hedge fund SAC Capital Advisors. He seems to be taking a similar approach to his real estate.
articles.abstract: Steven A. Cohen is known for his rapid-fire trading style, moving in and out of stocks with dizzying speed at his hedge fund SAC Capital Advisors. He seems to be taking a similar approach to his real estate.
articles.lead_paragraph: Steven A. Cohen is known for his rapid-fire trading style, moving in and out of stocks with dizzying speed at his hedge fund SAC Capital Advisors.

articles.headline: 3rd Oral Drug to Treat MS Is Approved by the F.D.A.
articles.snippet: Wall Street analysts, doctors and patients expect Tecfidera to become a blockbuster because of its efficacy, relative safety and convenience.
articles.abstract: Wall Street analysts, doctors and patients expect Tecfidera to become a blockbuster because of its efficacy, relative safety and convenience.
articles.lead_paragraph: A chemical once used to treat sofas — until it was found to cause rashes and blisters in people who sat on them — is now poised to become a major therapy for multiple sclerosis.

articles.headline: Attacks Used the Internet Against Itself to Clog Traffic
articles.snippet: A huge denial-of-service attack that eventually slowed traffic across much of the Internet relied on vulnerabilities in the network’s own hardware to amplify its effects.
articles.abstract: A huge denial-of-service attack that eventually slowed traffic across much of the Internet relied on vulnerabilities in the network’s own hardware to amplify its effects.
articles.lead_paragraph: An escalating cyberattack involving an antispam group and a shadowy group of attackers has now affected millions of people across the Internet, raising the question: How can such attacks be stopped?
articles.byline: By John Markoff and Nicole Perlroth

articles.headline: Success on Political Front Can Be Setback in Gay Rights
articles.snippet: The Supreme Court justices signaled this week that they might limit their intervention on same-sex marriage, since the democratic process seems to be playing out on its own.
articles.abstract: The Supreme Court justices signaled this week that they might limit their intervention on same-sex marriage, since the democratic process seems to be playing out on its own.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — As the justices of the Supreme Court struggled with the question of same-sex marriage this week, politicians in Congress kept handing down their own verdict. One after another, a series of lawmakers in recent days endorsed allowing gay men and lesbians to wed.

articles.headline: Broad-Based S.&P. 500-Stock Index Ends at Record High
articles.snippet: The S.&P. 500 is widely seen as a broader reflection of the stock market than the blue-chip Dow Jones industrial average, which passed its own 2007 milestone this month.
articles.abstract: The S.&P. 500 is widely seen as a broader reflection of the stock market than the blue-chip Dow Jones industrial average, which passed its own 2007 milestone this month.
articles.lead_paragraph: The most widely followed barometer of the United States stock market rose to a new high on Thursday, exceeding its 2007 peak, while most of the rest of the world could only look on in envy.

articles.headline: Syria’s War Invades a Campus That Acted as a Sanctuary
articles.snippet: The blast from a mortar shell killed at least 10 people at Syria’s flagship Damascus University, where students had done their best to go about their business.
articles.abstract: The blast from a mortar shell killed at least 10 people at Syria’s flagship Damascus University, where students had done their best to go about their business.
articles.lead_paragraph: DAMASCUS, Syria — More and more students at Damascus University were skipping classes. The whack and thump of shelling in the distance punctuated the hum of the downtown campus. Some students walked miles to avoid the security checkpoints that choke traffic.
